"It's been fun to play goal for this team all year long, but especially the last few games. We've been playing incredible. Obviously, can't get complacent. Just got to keep on going to work."

Charlie Lindgren after picking up his third straight win in net tonight.

"We're playing better. We're putting together better 60-minute efforts. Sometimes it's not our best, but I think we're more consistent when we're playing ... we're not at our best yet."

Lars Eller postgame.

urls.title: Caps Finish With Flourish in Philly
urls.description: Caps head home from longest trip of season with consecutive wins, Ovechkin creeps closer to 800 and to Gretzky's mark

tweets.text: The Capitals are now 12-1-1 when scoring three or more goals this season. In addition, the Capitals improved to 3-2-1 against Metropolitan Division opponents.
With a 4-1 win tonight, the Capitals improved to 15-7-0 in their last 22 games against the Flyers dating back to the 2018-19 season.
Goaltender Charlie Lindgren stopped 29 of 30 shots tonight and earned his second consecutive win. Over his last two games, Lindgren has posted a 2-0-0 record with a 1.51 GAA and a .950 SV%.

Evgeny Kuznetsov recorded his team-leading 17th assist of the season on the Capitals' fourth goal. With the assist, Kuznetsov passed Bengt Gustafsson (359) for the eighth-most assists in franchise history.
Ovechkin scores his second empty net goal to extend the lead to 4-1. Ovechkin is now seven goals shy of passing Gordie Howe (801) for second on the NHL’s all-time goals list.
